Reviews.Title: “nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: billybaggins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for one night. We were pleased with the cleanliness, proximity to the event we were attending, and the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. We arrived at 11AM hoping but not expecting to be allowed to check in as we were very tired. The staff located a room for us and said we could go right up. It was much appreciated. The only complaint was that our room faced Southwest Marine Drive and the traffic noise was quite audible.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Kathy A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient, clean and a huge bargain! The shuttle service is convenient and prompt. The staff is great and the restaurants are good.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Scotia-7
Reviews.Content: We always stay @ the coast over night on our trips to Europe. Its nothing fancy, but it is always clean, has all the amenities you need, and the staff has always been pleasant. This trip we want to especially thank JC for being so accommodating and cheerful - he went out of his way for us. We hope the Coast realizes what good front desk staff they have. Thank you. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A little-known gem amongst Vancouver hotels”
Reviews.Author: Maria-Katriina
Reviews.Content: For whatever marketing reason, the Coast Vancouver Airport Hotel prefers to list itself as being in Richmond, whereas it is actually situated on the Vancouver end of the Oak Street Bridge. The hotel is handily located at the intersection of Oak Street and Marine Drive, on numerous bus-lines. As a frequent business visitor to Vancouver, I appreciate the quietly-understated ambience of the hotel: it is calm, unassuming, clean, and safe. Frankly, for a business traveller, this is the best deal going. The bellman / van driver, Jacky, cheerfully takes me to and from the airport, so that I might more conveniently board the Skytrain for downtown each morning. I come back to my room to discover a chocolate bar on the work-table next the telephone -- these folks look after their guests. I consider this hotel to be my pied-a-terre in Vancouver, and cherish it. Rumours of its eventual conversion to assisted-living condos have thus far proven to be false -- I do hope, and indeed anticipate, being able to stay here on my Vancouver trips for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Our Visa number used next morning by night shift clerk”
Reviews.Author: Joelle M
Reviews.Content: Overnight stay prebooked as arriving from Maui late that evening and leaving at 07:00am next morning to get back home (across Canada). Shuttle bus young driver very pleasant and tipped both ways. Nationality?? guy at reception (Feb. 4th to 5th night shift) has to be the one who used our Visa as it is the only person my husband handed out his Canadian Visa during the 2 weeks away from Canada (used US Visa only during our holiday). Arrived pm on Sunday Feb 5th, got a call from Visa Monday during morning verifying if my husband's card had been used to purchase a $1,300.00 holiday plus another $200.00 at an electronic shop - which he never did as we were flying back home during that time. Thank you Visa for picking it up and not charging us. COAST VANCOUVER AIRPORT - WATCH YOUR EMPLOYEE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: Called the hotel, they picked us up in a timely fashion in their shuttle. Very friendly driver and was checked in by a very good desk clerk, Jacky. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Online Booking Pitfall”
Reviews.Author: Randal704
Reviews.Content: beware when booking online as we had booked online and on check in were not impressed with being hit with an additional $12.50 parking charge for parking a vehicle - this should be an up front item being required to be displayed or mentioned on the website prior to booking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a night ...”
Reviews.Author: Mort69
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport, not horribly expensive. Has a local chain restaurant and pub as amenities. Clean, courteous staff. Pay parking. The neighborhood is a tad seedy though. They will tell you to put your valuables out of sight if you park here. Room was small and slightly outdated, but clean and provided all expected amenities. This is good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Cora05
Reviews.Content: We were in and out of this place very quickly (arrived at 10:30pm and left at 6am) but for what we needed, it was good. The bed was comfortable, room was quiet and had a strong wi-fi connection, front desk service was friendly and fast, and the complimentary shuttle runs every 30 minutes. There's a Whitespot in the same building, but unfortunately it closed before we got there and opened after we left, and we didn't see any 24-hour eateries nearby (something to check into if you'll need that). The washrooms are small and dated but the shower was good. The shuttle driver picked us up in quite casual/frumpy pants, but his friendly attitude and efficiency made up for that! We had a rather obnoxious passenger with us and he handled it smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Good sleep!”
Reviews.Author: ckpianodude
Reviews.Content: Coming back from Whistler and using this hotel for 1 night to catch an early flight the next day worked out perfectly. The 24 hour shuttle service was great, the rooms were clean, comfortable bed and it was quiet. The service at the front desk was friendly and we had a very nice meal at the restaurant next door. We would stay here again if we have to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “close, convenient, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and efficient. The shuttle to/from the airport was quick and seamless (they arrived promptly and the drive was 5 minutes). The beds were very comfortable with great pillows. Coffee, tea and newspapers were a nice touch. Two attached restaurants make the stay convenient. Even though the bathrooms were dated, they were clean. This stopover hotel exceeded our expectations (based on the very reasonable price that we paid) - after some long travels, we wanted an easy, comfortable night's sleep and that's exactly what we got.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff”
Reviews.Author: switchgyrl
Reviews.Content: staff are friendly and helpful. my stay was quiet and all i expected. bathtub could use a little work, but this is one of the older hotels in this chain. nice big pillows & all amenities are functioning. the beds at coast hotels are the best. the staff were fully aware of my late check in as i instructed in my email. pick up at airport was at midnight and again, no problems, just pick up the hotel phone at the airport foyer & about 15 minutes later, i was on my way. no other passengers, so they went out of their way to pick me up. very nice when you are arriving from a long, uncomfortable trip. no problems and got a good nites sleep which is the main thing isn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Close By and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Rover1949
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coast Vancouver Airport the night before we flew to Maui and again on return. It is a 5 minute drive away from airport but free shuttle is fabulous. They run till 2 am if needed! The hotel has a Whitespot Restaurant attached making it very convenient. Rooms are great and beds very comfortable. Highly recommen this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kerrie F
Reviews.Content: We flew into Vancouver 1 day ahead of our Alaskan cruise so we didn't take a chance on missing the cruise so we needed a night in a motel close to the airport. They had free airport transfer & an very comfortable room w/ high speed internet, coffee maker, etc. I didn't want to get out of the bed, it was so comfortable. It was clean and everyone we dealt w/ on staff was kind and helpful. Look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend to all air travellers”
Reviews.Author: madeiramom
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because they offer free parking, 7 nights for every night you stay at the hotel. We stayed there for the night before and the night after our flights to Mexico and everything was perfect.It's a bit more expensive than some of the other airport hotels but the parking makes it well worth it. You can park your car and take the free shuttle across the bridge to the airport and when you arrive home again, they pick you up with a quick phone call. We were dressed in Mexico attire and FREEZING when we arrived but they came right away. After two weeks of hard Mexican hotel beds the beds in this hotel were likely the most comfortable we've ever slept on, heaven! They also checked our winter coats for free so we didn't have to leave them in the car or pack them to Mexico. All around a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great stop for a layover”
Reviews.Author: Smashedbunny
Reviews.Content: I had a layover and booked this hotel through hotwire. I wanted a nice, quiet, clean hotel near the airport to spend the night in and that's exactly what I got. The staff are exceptionally friendly and do their job well. I had breakfast in the white spot restaurant, it was good but not great. The free WiFi was fast. There is a lot of competition for airport hotels so shop around, the low rate I got online made it worth trying.

Reviews.Title: “It's quite a place”
Reviews.Author: Phil R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here annually since the mid 80's. Staff always friendly and look to accommodate requests. Rooms are kept up to date. Prices remain 'visitor friendly'. Will continue to stay here. Location is ideal for people arriving after a long haul flight needing a good sleep to get over jet lag -- the collect you from the airport 'on demand'. They take you back to the airport at half hour intervals.

Reviews.Title: “Service makes this hotel exceptional”
Reviews.Author: funfamilytime
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and clean. Not only that, as the moms responsible for team breakfast, we appreciated the table brought up to our room, without reminder, which helped us serve our girls much easier. Excellent staff . Very service oriented and helpful. Evening front desk clerks were really helpful in helping to figure out parking for one of the team dad's RV and where we should eat for supper. Urmilla in housekeeping, in particular, asked to make sure all was good and also helped with extra garbage bags, etc. to make it easier to serve team food. Hallways were uncomfortably warm. Rooms were much cooler. Beds really comfortable. White Spot restaurant was great. Our team needed a late dinner, right before closing. Restaurant took a last minute preorder after Boston Pizza refused to deliver based on proximity (order had been prearranged) I think the White Spot manager's name was Cassandra (?) - offered 5 suggestions for me to ask the girls during their time out - and then she had all the meals waiting when the girls arrived at 9:40. Made me look like a star mom! Parents ate at the attached pub restaurant. Again our server was exceptional, offering honest suggestions for food/wine selection. Good humour and promptness ... we weren't expecting much and she definitely added to our experience. Both White Spot and the Pub restaurant were very reasonably priced and well run. This is a nice, comfortable hotel with exceptional service. We've stayed at many hotels with our team and this one was the best yet for friendly, attentive staff. It's quite remarkable to have such consistently helpful service from all areas of a hotel: Urmilla in housekeeping, front desk people working after 5 pm, manager at White Spot, waitress at Pub Restaurant and also, the sweet Australian woman who took my reservation, suggested a banquet table to be put in our room for easier breakfast serving and the staff who made sure it happened without a reminder. I also observed the hotel manager, when his front desk clerk was dealing with a parking charge complaint over the phone and two teams were piling in at the same time, advise his clerk to refund the charge so as not to make a small issue one that would make us wait to check in (and probably increased the satisfaction of the customer on the phone). Would highly recommend this hotel to travellers looking for a clean, quiet and comfortable hotel room at a reasonable price, with service that helps make your stay as easy as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: samsara_10
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed overnight on route to another site. My colleague made the reservation and I must admit on arriving I was apprehensive. The lobby was unremarkable and the noise outside was strong. I was concerned. I expressed my concerns (need for quiet and need for a microwave) to the 'bubbly receptionist' .On arriving at my room I was delighted. It was really a perfect stay. The room was 445. Exceptional, large, wonderful sunset and sunrise in room. caveat,.there was a microwave but nothing to microwave on so i had to use the ice-bucket to heat my pasta (it was wrapped in foil) Great reception staff, lots of available parking. A super stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Quick Overnight”
Reviews.Author: Robin S
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for a brief stop. Airport shuttle was prompt-room was very clean-staff was friendly and helpful-restrauant was very good.We were on our way to a cruise and had a nice cab ride to the pier.

Reviews.Title: “bad surprises invoice”
Reviews.Author: Fabio M
Reviews.Content: i'm your customer every year,from your invoice number 95263 date 7/16/2011 I was in your hotel, all perfect ! but when I back 9/7/2011 I had bad surprice , because I read 2 costs absolutely unexpected. invoice n. 98545 I choices your hotel because of famous and serious company, and perfect location for rent car in Enterprice very close. when I arrived ,your employee give me ,for sign the ticket for parking car, that I thought was free(included in room price), because i had to return the car, after few minutes. and read 9.68 cad plus taxes. furthermore, i read another cost for movies, absolutely no true, i watched channel 40 tv, (i remeber the programs"flashpoint" and "mentalist") i had not autorized the movie and I read 16.99 cad plus taxes!! at last i payed 29,87 dollars for nothing. i thank for assistance the employees in many cases , realy kinds and professionals, and I could not less the shuttle for airport , for this dispute,but in this case ther are 2 wrongs, i hope next time in your hotel ,to have bonus for repayment best regards dr. fabio malattia

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: georgetown_minky
Reviews.Content: the room was clean and the staff was good. I used the complimentary airport shuttle and it was very quick, no stop offs anywhere. The complimentary internet access is wireless and worked fine. try to stay as close to the first floor since the elevators are soooo slow. i went to the pub and White Spot with no complaints

Reviews.Title: “efficient and handy”
Reviews.Author: bucketlist50_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and after a trip. Rooms are clean and beds comfortable, the hotel is secure and clean. It offers a stay and park for free package that is unbeatable and we have used the Coast several times because of this. Free shuttle to the airport and it is punctual when you call for pickup

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: babsinbc
Reviews.Content: The Coast Vancouver Airport is an affordable, comfortable and convenient location with regular 24 hour shuttle to/from the Vancouver International Airport and a 5 minute bus ride to Canada Line rapid transit to downtown Vancouver, connections to North and West Vancouver and areas east of Vancouver. The hotel was recently renovated including upgraded fixtures and bedding in rooms to make it on par with 4-5 star hotels. There is a small fitness centre, a business centre and free Wi-Fi in the hotel as well as a White Spot Restaurant and pub in the same complex and, Cravings, another good restaurant less than a 5 minute walk away. A few rooms have kitchenettes, many have small fridges. The staff are great: friendly, welcoming and very helpful... not much turnover which says a lot about the management of this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: RosieP14221
Reviews.Content: It was what you would expect for the money- just a basic hotel- no frills but clean, accessible, air conditioned, comfortable beds. We were trying to save money, so we stayed away from the tourist area downtown. We found the public transportation to be easy to use to get to the harbor was easy and from there we got everywhere we needed without too much difficulty. There is a chain restaurant downstairs and the food was surprisingly good.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, again!”
Reviews.Author: jayegold
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy our stay at the Coast. Besides being an excellent location for our family visits, we find it a breath of fresh air in the big city! The staff is very welcoming, they always have a smile and are right there when we need something. The rooms are clean and fresh, we appreciate the frig in the room and having a newspaper at our door in the mornings. The parking is easy and there is a restaurant on site. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A great convenient location and value”
Reviews.Author: OcalaAl
Reviews.Content: Excellent, free on-call hotel shuttle... 5-minute ride from airport. Although the hotel does not have a scenic view and the property footprint is modest it is adjacient to a safe appearing residential area that I felt comfortable walking in. We did not notice any annoying airport noise on a Friday night/Saturday morning. The interiors were very nicely decorated, clean and fresh throughout. The standard queen bed room is modestly sized but not cramped in any way. The staff was friendly, very courteous and excellent in wanting to make our stay a pleasant experience. The on-premise restaurant served us an excellent breakfast and the server was great. Cab fare from the hotel to the cruise ship pier was $28 on Saturday about noontime and a very pleasant ride. We'd stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: EUReviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night before our flight back to the UK after a two week holiday round British Columbia. After arriving by seaplane, the hotel were most obliging in sending their courtesy shuttle to collect us. The receptionist upon arrival was very friendly and had upgraded us to a superior room. The room itself was very big, with wonderfully comfortable beds - perfect for getting some good sleep in before a very long flight. It was very clean and had a well-fitted bathroom with lovely amenities. We wanted to go back into the centre of Vancouver and this was very easy with the Skytrain from Marine Drive station, which is about a 15min walk away. There are also busses going to the city centre various points on Marine Drive closer to the hotel. When we checked out there was quite a queue and we were worried there wouldn't be room on the shuttle to the terminal, but the driver made sure there would be room for us. I would definitely stay here again if I needed a hotel by Vancouver Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: dfh98
Reviews.Content: We attrended a wedding at VanDusen Gardens in Vancouver. Expedia gave us a great rate for the Coast Vancouver Airport, which was about 5 minutes from the wedding site. The Pro's They allowed us an early check in as the wedding was at 2pm and we wanted to shower and change. Breakfast at the White Spot on site was yummy That's pretty much it for the Pro's The Cons Very noisy hotel. We were there during summer and we couldn't have our windows open - even though it was very hot in the room because the airplanes were just really loud - the air conditioner was also very loud The room was the smallest hotel room I had ever stayed in - airport hotel or not. I am very glad i didn't take a cat with me because i wouldn't have been able to swing it..........Altogether we had about 10 rooms and everyone remarked that they thought the rooms were very small The room wasn't very clean at all. I don't think that the bathroom had been cleaned between guests as there was makeup on the counter and in the sink and no towels. I just grabbed some off the housekeeping cart. The maid woke us at 7:30 to clean the room............ and we were checking out that day.... I told her she had woken me up and she asked if she should come back in 10 minutes...... i would definately not return to this hotel. We have stayed in other Vancouver Airport Hotels that were a lot better for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for what it is”
Reviews.Author: heidi s
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills, clean, decent hotel near the airport. The shuttle runs 24 hours. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. This is not where you would book your honeymoon but they don't advertise themselves as such. For a quick commute to the airport it is excellent. The surrounding neighborhood is industrial but safe. I stayed there overnight with my 1 year-old son and they set up a crib in the room for us. We arrived at 1:30am and the manager at the front desk was extremely helpful. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: czechmate1ca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Aug. 13-16th as it was close to Holy Family Hospital where we were visiting family. We stayed in room 339 which is a Superior King Room. The bus stop was right in front of the hotel so it made getting to the hospital very convenient and it is also close to The Canada Link which we also took to go downtown and to a shopping centre. The hotel is very clean and we had no issues with anything. There is a White Spot restaurant attached to the hotel and there is also a pub next door. The front desk staff was very helpful teaching us about the bus system (normally we would rent a car but decided not to). There is not much else around the hotel to entertain you though, so it is really a great place for only 1-2 nights, but I wouldn't think long term. On that note, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you have to catch an early flight.”
Reviews.Author: kasclark
Reviews.Content: Not the most luxurious hotel. No frills here, just simple rooms, nice beds and a 24/7 shuttle to the airport. The level of cleanliness and comfort is acceptable for one or two night's stay and the staff is very friendly. Two restaurants next door for a quick bite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, comfortable and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: MagicCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2011. We chose it because it offers a free shuttle to and from the airport, which is really easy. When we arrived, we were at first a bit disappointed by the location, as we were not prepared to those surroundings : crossing of streets with a lot of traffic, train, airplanes... Despite this, we slept very well and really enjoyed our stay. The staff was really friendly and helpful; I'm thinking especially about that girl who very patiently explained to me which busses I had to take to go to the Summer Night Market and this after her normal working hours. To go downtown, just walk 1/2 block and you'll be at the bus stop (about 30 min trip) - very easy ! Ask for a free street map of Vancouver at the reception. The room was a bit outdated, but large, clean and comfortable, with free internet access, free coffee, tea and even hot chocolate. Should we go back to Vancouver, we would definitely go back to that hotel but we would ask for a room at the back (with less street noise and a view on the parking lot instead of the street and the viaduct).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, outstanding food”
Reviews.Author: wearytraveler000
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, quiet and comfortable. The White Spot restaurant in the hotel has outstanding fresh seafood and creative entrees. Free shuttle to and from the airport picks you up within 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, central location”
Reviews.Author: Bethianhope
Reviews.Content: We stayed as 2 adults and one child for 3 nights. Coast is well located to the airport, public transport and shopping malls. The hotel has ample restaurant opportunities for familes and adults, including a White Spot and a pub. Parking is also easy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Simple”
Reviews.Author: ba340
Reviews.Content: Sent here as an Air Canada distressed passenger (i.e i missed my connection due to their delays) - Hotel is a 10 minute shuttle ride. Easy check in, clean rooms, comfortable bed. Free Wifi. Onsite dining options linited but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “It's alright...”
Reviews.Author: SophiePR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not bad for a 1 night stay. It has arpt transportation which is one less thing to think about and in our trip was a saving matter. My son's flight was cancelled and we couldn't meet as agreed but I was at ease since I knew once he got to Vancouver the hotel would pick him up. The bad part is that the rest closes at 930pm so if you arrived later than that you will need to eat in the bar where kids are not welcomed for obvious reasons so you will need to order take out. Besides that restaurant there is really nothing else around in that area. The staff is very attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenJones0001
Reviews.Content: If you have a layover this hotel is perfect. It's clean and tidy, they have a free shuttle to the airport and it is good value. I would use it again if I have to stop overnight close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive glasses stolen from Suitcase”
Reviews.Author: batchelorboy
Reviews.Content: Coast hotel is suitable for a quick layover. Good restaurant. Prada glasses were stolen from my suitcase while it was supposed to be secure in their holding area while we were in Mexico. They deny this. I was very careful not to write this review without making any mistakes. I am absolutely certain that they were in the suitcase and 100% sure they were removed by someone on staff. So please be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Solid bet for One Night at YVR”
Reviews.Author: boddicker52
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be more than acceptable. Quick shuttle on demand from the airport, even late at night. Two free internet stations, and a White Spot restaurant on the ground floor. Room was fine, but the area around the hotel is depressing. I arrived at 2 AM, and left at 11 AM the next morning, moving to the Hilton which is in a much nicer area. At the rack rate of $129, I would not be happy, but with my winning bid of $43 on Priceline being 1/3 of that, I felt it was money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for airport area on Vancouver side of Oak Street Bridge.”
Reviews.Author: PogoJ
Reviews.Content: My room was clean and comfortable if a bit dated small and stuffy. Some reviewers comment on the noise from bridge and Marine Drive traffic. Ask for an inner courtyard room if you want a bit more quiet. Decent predictable White Spot restaurant. The hotel is convenient to Granville Street and Oak Street transit and not far from the Canada Line rapid transit. The Marpole area is pleasant enough for walking around and has a number of good restaurants and coffee places. The airport shuttle is also handy. Perhaps best of all is that it is possible to get very good rates at this hotel through on line brokers, making it something of a 'best buy'.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: talaha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located and provides free shuttle service to the airport. Granville Street is also close, in which there are numerous places to eat sushi. Our room was clean and comfortable and we had no problems with our stay here. Our room was a bit smaller than what we are used to in Canada but we had a good night's sleep for very little money.

Reviews.Title: “It's a dump and soooo noisey - may as well sleep on the street”
Reviews.Author: BCLady48
Reviews.Content: So noisey. Whether windows were open or closed the noise was terrible. The room is old, outdated, furniture should be given to charity. These rooms are way overdue for an update. Towels small. Can't easily get luggage to car and hotel entrance is hard to comprehend. Has wireless internet. Free parking. Take the time to go to the Coast Downtown or any other hotel. A Super 8 or Motel 6 would be a huge upgrade compared to this place. Avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the night...”
Reviews.Author: NG_Travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coast for a night and it was average...Clean sheets and no bedbugs... After reading the review we were a little bit concern about that but we didn't see nothing... If you are scared about bedbugs bring a garbage bag put your things in it and put it in the bath... It was an average hotel and and it was convenient for our need, and overnight stay...

Reviews.Title: “An Old Dump but Serviceable”
Reviews.Author: Cepage
Reviews.Content: The only reasons to stay here are that you need to be close to the airport and you got a good rate. For around $55 (including the taxes and other charges) on a site like Priceline, it is an ok deal. The wireless internet worked and was relatively fast. There was an in-room coffee maker which I did not use. The shower was serviceable. Towels were of ample supply and appeared clean. The rooms are very dated and if mine was typical, proper maintenance is not being done. The lightbulb in one of 2 freestanding lamps next to the bed was burned out. The wall socket next to the "desk" area was not firmly attached to the wall. The toilet flush lever was loose and flapping in the breeze. These are just 3 examples that immediately come to mind. The room smelled of tobacco smoke but was covered up with some sort of vague aerosol spray masking odor. The bed was ok and I did not notice any bedbugs, nor did I awaken feeling as if I had been bitten. I parked on the street across from the hotel rather than pay $10+ to park in the lot. The hotel location is in a noisy and charmless industrial area. You could walk to a nearby McDonalds or a Subway, or to 2 or 3 unappetizing looking Chinese restaurants. There were no ATMs or banks within walking distance, although a service station appeared to have a proprietary ATM inside. There is a station for the Sky train within walking distance if that appeals to you to get out of the area without a car. In summary, I'd consider staying here if I needed to be next to the airport and got a really cheap rate. Otherwise, I would definitely look ELSEWHERE.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs - Hotel dealing as well as possible with difficult situation”
Reviews.Author: kmstreme
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and well-run, and we have stayed at this location on numerous occasions and recommended it to friends. However, on my recent stay on the 4th floor, I was bitten, and a pest control visit later that day confirmed for the hotel and me that it was bedbugs behind the headboard (I had checked the mattress already, and it was immaculate, so I didn't think bedbugs would be an issue). They moved me to a new room, and had the pest control person inspect it, for my peace of mind, which I appreciated. Though i did not get new bites, when I awoke the next morning, most of the rooms around me had warning signs on them, indicating bedbugs. The management offered a refund for my stay without being asked, and were apologetic and helpful, as were staff. The whole city is dealing with this problem, in all classes of hotels, and my advice is regardless of where you stay is to ask for the maintenance record of any room you are assigned to, as hotels should be able to tell you if there have been bedbug reports or other maintenance issues in your room, based on their records. If you have been exposed to bedbugs, bag all your belongings in plastic before heading home/to your car, and deal with them appropriately once home.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dave1986uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after arriving at YVR. It's about 5-10 minutes from the airport, and they provide a free shuttle to and from the airport which was very helpful. The hotel was comfortable with good quality furniture and free wi-fi. There's a White Spot restaurant which was good for breakfast, and also provides room service. There isn't much around the hotel, but it works perfectly for a brief stop over when you need to be close to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport - good 'overnighter'”
Reviews.Author: mar2dav
Reviews.Content: With a 24 hour Shuttle to/from the Airport (YVR) this is a good spot to spend the night before flying out of Vancouver. Old, but not showing it's age, our room was quiet (even tho' facing a main street), very well kept & clean with all the standard amenities. Of note: On site parking is minimal (we had to go around the block to find access when checking in.) Unless there is other parking this is not a spot to leave your vehicle while away. (We left our car elsewhere & took a cab to the Hotel later in the evening after our check-in.) We have absolutely no qualms about recommending this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “economical - not much around, make sure get away from traffic”
Reviews.Author: The_sun_seekerr
Reviews.Content: economical - 10 minutes from the Vancouver airport. Not much to see, very industrial. Make sure you ask for the parking lot otherwise will be facing the hotel. Everything is great, internet a bit slow, decor nice, clean, the lobby doesn't show it. The restaurant by lobby was indicated to have had mouse running around. I tried a fantastic Italian around the block (cravings.ca) that is top rate. they have a free shuttle that runs to the airport 24hr, every half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Kitchenettes with no kitchen! Avoid the suites and get connecting rooms instead”
Reviews.Author: KDVictoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite with 3 children. The rooms are very dated (leaky faucets, 1980s decor, old furniture, etc.) and our room smelled musty and smoky as it hadn't been used for at least a month. The sofa-bed was so uncomfortable that we took the mattress off the bed and put it on the floor. The "master" bedroom is only closed off by two sliding doors that don't close properly so there is no privacy. The "kitchenette" has only a microwave and a fridge that doesn't work, and no dishes or pots. After raising a fuss we were given some dishes but were told that the hotel is not allowed to provide them because of its contract with the in-hotel restaurant. The second floor is undergoing renovations and when the paint fumes got too bad we were moved to connecting rooms on the fourth floor. That was a welcome change. The beds and bedding were much more comfortable and the rooms were in much better condition. The only highlight was the housekeeping staff. They were exceptional - hardworking and thorough - and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: emagreen
Reviews.Content: We found the websaver price on their website and were very happy for the price that we paid. The rooms are a bit older, but have all of the amenities that you would expect and were clean. Clean is my number one priority. Both times we stayed here we had a room facing the bridge/highway, but the noise was barely noticeable. Hotel staff were very friendly and we enjoyed the White Spot at breakfast, and the pub for dinner one night. All in all, I would stay here again for the websaver price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: pounie01
Reviews.Content: We booked this as a stopover hotel and were very disapointed. The rooms were not clean at all. Floor in the bathroom was not cleaned, garbage was not emptied, hair (lots) in the bathtub, etc. We would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect pre-cruise hotel in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: bushpilot44
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent, I am always on the lookout for nice hotels that are not too expensive as places to stay before leaving on a cruise from a distant city. I have taken four groups on the Princess northbound Alaskan cruise from Vancouver and have found the Coast Vancouver Airport hotel to be ideal for this purpose. Here are the reasons. (1) Price. At $95-115, it is relatively inexpensive for Vancouver in the summer (downtown hotels are easily 3x as much). There is free street parking and only $8 in their lot. (2) Quality. While it is not the Ritz, it is modern, clean, and well-maintained with free robes and fridges in the superior rooms..and super comfortable beds and pillows. (3) Convenient. They have a free courtesy phone in the arrival area and pick you up quickly. (4) Food. The White Spot Restaurant on the ground floor has great casual food for any meal and there are several fine dining places nearby. Tracey, the reservation manager, is a delight to work with and the desk is always helpful and efficient. If you are doing a day trip to historic Steveston (recommended), it is just a short drive. I have found this hotel works perfectly for my small cruise groups. I recommend going 2 days early, rent a car from Alamo or National, and drop it off at the Pan Pacific cruise terminal just before your cruise and save the expensive cab ride. They are the only two rental companies that have that provision (Enterprise may be added soon, same ownership).If you do not want to rent, the shuttle driver will take you to(and pick you up from) a Metro subway stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: acoya
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed at this Hotel the night before we left for L.A. & the night that we came back. Hotel was easy to find, staff at Front Desk along with the HSKP staff were incredibly friendly & helpful. The 2 rooms that we stayed in were beautiful! Very clean, beautiful view of Vancouver, along with mini fridge, coffee maker, lots of new towels in bathroom, shampoo, conditioner, soap, make-up removing clothes, good size T.V. & free Wireless Internet access. There is a White Spot restaurant in the hotel which was great. They also have a Complimentary 24-hour shuttle for the Vancouver airport. Would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Good as only an over-nighter”
Reviews.Author: VancouverValleyGrl
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip through the CAA website and chose it for its price and proximity to YVR. The room we stayed in was the puniest hotel room I've ever been in. We only stayed one night to catch an early-morning flight so it suited our needs; I wouldn't stay here otherwise. The idea of this hotel even charging a parking fee blew my mind: there was no parkade but instead a parking lot, unsupervised, with a sign that read, "park at your own risk." Yikes!

Reviews.Title: “Did the job at reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: P_n_R_Herts
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned after booking to discover the hotel is on a major highway and next to a flyover, but our room at the back had no traffic noise and we got a good night’s sleep. It’s a perfectly standard motel with a bath and shower – we had no complaints. It was significantly cheaper than any other hotel with an airport shuttle I could find ; why pay more when you only spend twelve hours in a place, most of it asleep? The restaurant is a White Spot (chain) branch. Pick-up from the airport took a long time but the shuttle is half-hourly from the hotel and we were there in less than 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to town by train”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNH37
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on way in and way out for wedding in Vancouver. Price is right. The bonus is the convenience in to town which I had not seen mentioned. Hop a bus immediately across the street which takes you to the Canada Line and drops you off in the middle of downtown. Since you are on the main line and not the extension to the airport the fare is $1.75 as a senior, $2.50 otherwise. On the return trip the bus stops at the front door. Since we arrived at 11PM and flew out at 6 AM 4 days later it was impractical to spend the first and last nights in town (and not worth the expense). Shuttle service runs between the hotel and the airport every 1/2 hour, around the clock.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars For Amazing Beds and Free Airport Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltravels6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived from Honolulu to Vancouver at 5:30 am after our honeymoon. We were very tired. The day before we had booked a room here because it was near the airport and cheap. Our Executive Hotel in downtown Vancouver would not let us check in until 3pm and we desperately needed to sleep. We were thrilled to have a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel. The shuttle driver was so friendly and helpful, he took all of our luggage for us, and even put it all the way up into our room for us while we checked in. He was so helpful we wanted to tip him extra but he would not accept it. He was happy to do his job. The guy at the front desk was very friendly and helpful even at such an early hour. We found out check out was at 12 pm and not 11 am and we were thrilled by this. When we got to our room we saw that it had 2 beds, had nice dark window shades and was clean. It had everything we needed. You can tell they have upgraded the place and focused on quality beds, linens and pillows. I have to say come here for the value and great sleep. I have never slept in a bed so plush and luxurious for this price! We have paid $400 a night for rooms that gave us such a great sleep. We passed out instantly. The pillows were ridiculously plush and comfortable and the duvet blanket was so amazing. I thought we would be destroyed from this trip, but coming to the Coast really saved our day. We checked out at noon after getting 5 hours of great sleep. We know we can come back to this hotel any time and have a great deal and great experience. The Executive Hotel we went to next did not have nearly as nice of beds or pillows and was twice the price. So for the business traveler or short term stay this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Won't use this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: amblesidebab
Reviews.Content: The hotel entrance isn't anything special.We didn't know whether to use the front door or the back door as the signs are poor-particularly when you come in late.There was a nasty, acrid smell outside. The room itself was clean but there was no milk or creamer on the welcome tray so we couldn't have tea or coffee..We couldn't get a drink to take to our room after 10.15 at night.The worst part was the noise-.It was noisy all night and so we were very tired going into our morning meeting. Nobody on the front desk said hello when we walked past-we could have been walking in off the street for all the notice that was taken of us. There is a parking charge and a pet charge for this hotel,so be aware that your 'deal ' isn't as good as it sounds.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly OK airport hotel - had no problems”
Reviews.Author: JeffStranks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ended up staying here for 2 weeks in March/April - unplanned but an emergency trip turned out to be bereavement, and the hotel was the best located to where my family is. Got a rate of 109 CDN + taxes, and we thought the place was just fine. Large room, comfortable bed, clean and well maintained, good bathroom with excellent hot water and also clean. Fridge was empty but there's a machine down the hall. Our room (237) overlooked the car park and road beyond and we slept just fine. Free internet worked very well. Reception staff were average (one or two) and very helpful (most). Shuttle to and from airport is very good, takes 5 minutes, literally, and is every half-hour. White Spot restaurant on the premises is good and reasonably cheap. There's a restaurant nearby called Cravings, little more up-market and quite good but nothing to rave about. So - don't stay here on vacation, as others have said it's not a great neighbourhood, although there are buses and a good connection to the Canada Line trains to get you downtown pretty quickly. But if you need a stopover, I'd recommend it, no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here”
Reviews.Author: NufNuf
Reviews.Content: I had to prepay this hotel for the Olympics - when my husband got seriously ill and we could not fly - this Hotel would do NOTHING to help us out - no credit in the future - no attempt to rebook no partial credit - I would NEVER stay here - wouldn't trust them.

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottisHot
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a couple nights and had no problems at all, not sure why everyone is giving it bad reviews. The location is a bit out of the way (but good if you just need a place for a stopover) but I never felt uncomfortable or unsafe at any time, even at night when I got back a couple times past midnight. The parking fee is kind of silly, however you can park on the street (literally) five feet away and I could still see my car out the window. The room was nice and clean, it was quiet and we slept great, and the front desk was great. Let us check in very early (8am, we were dead tired after a flight).

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for your $$$”
Reviews.Author: skljajic
Reviews.Content: This is a very straight forward hotel and actually offers good value for the money. I must admit that I actually enjoyed my stay there. The restaurant was also OK. My room was clean and I had a good bed, rested well.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good value, upgrade to one of the suites”
Reviews.Author: VacationQueen24
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for under $50. We upgraded to the superior suite for an extra $100, which I would definitely recommend. The superior suite is extremely spacious with a living room, pull out sofa bed, roomy bathroom, a kitchenette and even a big dining table. They charged $8/day (CAD) for parking, which I wasn't too happy about because all other hotels in the area are not charging for parking. The garage was kinda sketchy too, pretty dark at night. The hotel is not in the area where I would like to walk around at night. Our room was super clean, quick and courteous customer service too. Surprisingly quiet for being right next to the freeway and in the vicinity of the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't choose it”
Reviews.Author: merVictoria_BC
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel that Air Canada put us in when our connection to Victoria was missed en route from Toronto to Vancouver. I would never choose to stay here. Everything was clean but we asked for a 6 a.m. wakeup call that never happened. Thankfully we were flying west and our internal alarm woke us at 6:05 and we made our flight. Nothing outstanding about this hotel. I was surprised given the Coast name as the Coast hotels in our city are quite a cut above this one.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: JustMe1943
Reviews.Content: Another reviewer described this hotel as "tired." I have to agree. The room we stayed in looked nothing like the photos on their website, but it was clean. Staff was helpful enough and the shuttle driver went to heroic lengths to find us at the airport. It's not a hotel at which I would care to spend an entire vacation, but it was adequate for overnight before boarding our cruise ship. Breakfast in the attached White Spot Restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: iwtb
Reviews.Content: Pros: - We got a room for $45 though priceline. - Our room had two double beds and a big desk and everything (including bathroom) looked clean. It faced the highway but the noise level was minimum. - Wireless internet worked perfectly. - The parking is at the back of the hotel and isn't free ($8? per night) but is covered and you won't get wet getting there even if it's raining. - The front desk staff was very friendly and allowed us to check in early since the room was available and our 3-year-old was asleep in the car and needed a better place to sleep. Cons: - The location is ok if you have a car but there isn't much around the hotel. (15 mintes walk to Skytrain station, I was told) - Our room key cards didn't work... or it didn't seem to work, and we had to make a few trips to the front desk (and they would remagnetize the cards) till a guy came up to help. He showed us how to open the door.. He told my husband to slide the card in and out very slowly, and it was helpful piece of info, but I felt the way he said it and behaved was kind of patronizing and rude. - No fridge.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Iralgo
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. We booked with Hotels.com. Guess the old saying "you get what you paid for" is correct. The place is old, run down and tired. The front desk was anything but helpful. Needed a refrigerator for my insulin, couldn't get one. Spoiled two bottles becasue I couldn't refrigerate. There is nothing around here unless you want to take a taxi. Should have stayed downtown and not out here. Just came off a fantastic cruise to Alaska and now this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected..”
Reviews.Author: amuro
Reviews.Content: Our room was small, the double sized bed was too small for two people. There wasn't much room in the bathroom either. We also found bugs in the sink of the bathroom. The hotel is located in a dark corner near the bridge therefore making travelling at night alone a little bit scary since the parking lot is in the back of an alley beside a pub. We had to pay $8 dollars plus tax per day for just parking at the hotel parking lot. We checked out the fitness center and they turned one of the small hotel rooms into a fitness center with 3 treadmills. Hotel staff was somewhat friendly and the house keeping ladies were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport shuttle, but the room is only OK”
Reviews.Author: pauljon98
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great shuttle bus service from the airport. My flight arrived at 1 am and they picked me up immediately from the airport when I called. The night driver was friendly and personable. The staff were professional. On the way back to the airport I went down at 10:31 (their clock's time) and they had cancelled the shuttle already, so they made me wait another 30 minutes rather than ask the driver. My room was a bit disappointing though. It was very clean. but was an 1980's decor - lots of pink and brass. The area is all isolated though. Stores on Granville street were a bit far to walk (10 mins walk). It had a small window overlooking a parking lot. The sheets were clean but not new and a bit worn in appearance.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel completely”
Reviews.Author: robbystar
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be avoided at all costs. The front office manger Nicki is one of the rudest person in the hotel industry. The hotel staff are liers and have no credibility. Definitely, do not make the mistake of staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: garyboy
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was nervous about this hotel but it was already booked and paid for on Hotwire (total cost 2 nites was $153 CAD) But....it was great, not sure if it is ideal as center for a longer term tourist visit, but for 1 or 2 days it was great value. Room was clean and newer with excellent king sized bed, nice sized bathroom that was spotless and everything worked great. Location isn't bad, short walk to South Granville with lots of restaurants or Sports Bar & White Spot right on premise. Parking was $8 for an adjacent lot, though we parked on the street 1/2 block from Hotel for free. Staff were very friendly. Will definitely stay here again with Hotwire rates....not sure I would pay a top dollar for this though because of location......does get a lot of traffic and bridge noise. Free shuttle to airport which is about 10 - 15 minutes away, inroom coffee & free wifi. I don't understand the bad reviews of some of the posters here, as we certainly didn't experience anything like the conditions they describe. Will definitely recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the good side of town....”
Reviews.Author: Kootenaygirlz
Reviews.Content: We checked in late at 10:00; we discover as soon as departing from the taxis this is the seedy side of Vancouver. The streets just out side the hotel entrance are lined with people just hanging around. We check in only to find out there was no house keeping staff of for the hotel to make up our daughters hide a bed. Strange??? No worries, we decided to make up the bed our selves. We pull out the hide bed to find a large blood stain on the mattress. Yep – three strikes we’re out of here!!! We had the front desk phone the Coast Plaza down town; and we promptly transfer there. As seedy as the Airport Coast was, they did arrange the transfer and the Coast Plaza did pick up the cost of our $30.00 taxis ride. I considered this an excellent example of customer service. The Coast Plaza was completely safe feeling; and the house keeping staff was able to make the bed up for our daughter (here we are now booking in at 12:00 midnight )

Reviews.Title: “We will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Judyno
Reviews.Content: Because of flight arrangements, we had to have two overnight stays close to the airport enroute to and from Guatemala. We chose the Coast Airport Hotel for two key reasons. First, because of its 24-hour every-half-hour shuttle to/from the airport, and second, because of the White Spot restaurant off the lobby, which would allow us to have a quick supper. This hotel turned out to be a very poor choice. The every-half-hour shuttle took almost an hour to arrive at the airport., which was extremely frustrating as the shuttles for other hotels often passed us two or three times while we were waiting. There were no apologies for this from the staff, though the driver was pleasant enough. After we went to our ever-so-basic and unattractive room, we went to the lobby to have dinner only to discover that the White Spot was closed. The only option was the pub, which turned out to be more of a sports bar, with umpteen TV sets blaring out the current games. Not our scene at all. It seems ironic that this Vancouver hotel turned out to me the most disappointing accommodation in our one-month, seven-hotel trip to Guatemala. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: sunnygirl0524
Reviews.Content: My flight was cancelled out of Vancouver so I was forced to find accomodations for the night. I decided to stay at the Coast Hotel close to the airport. The complimentary shuttle was great and the driver personable. My room was clean and comfortable with some nice extras for the morning. The staff was very accomodating and friendly. I will definitely stay there again if I have a layover in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: kg57
Reviews.Content: We booked this as an overnight/free parking special before an early morning flight to Mexico (only available through the tour operator). For $ 50, how could you go wrong? Parking alone at private-airport-lots costs more than that for a week. Yes, the room was small; I'd imagine that they keep the smallest rooms for the particular promotion. But it was certainly adequate, and the airport-shuttle is very efficient. It leaves on the half-hour durinig the day - and on the way back, we simply phoned and it was there within a few minutes. We had dinner at the pub-restaurant. It was fine - we didn't eat at the White Spot on site, but for any tourists who are wondering - White Spot is an excellent family-restaurant chain and I've never had a bad meal at any of their outlets over the past 45 years or so. I wouldn't recommend this as an excellent location for tourists trying to explore the entire Vancouver area within a few days, but it certainly worked in our situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for convenience to airport”
Reviews.Author: littletinyeep
Reviews.Content: The Coast Vancouver Airport was comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and welcoming. The 24 hour shuttle service is a definite asset to the hotel. The only problem was arranging a roll-away bed. We had requested it both times and it was never there when we went into the room. Upon checkout the first stay, we reminded them of the roll-away for our 2nd night that was coming up but again, they failed to have it prepared. On the plus side, the bed was quickly set up. Overall, I would stay here again purely for the comfort and 24-hour shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: lillama
Reviews.Content: My extended family stayed at this hotel for a night, and it was just right for our needs. I had read the reviews online, and was a little uncertain about the place based on some of the comments, but I decided to try it based on price and location. Rest assured that this is a terrific airport hotel. The shuttle service was totally reliable and very courteous. The outside of the building isn`t very pretty, but the interior is very nice. Our room was spacious and spotless, and the bathroom came with many deluxe products for us to use. I recall that there was a coffee pot and other amenities in the room. It is a good idea to get an interior room to avoid the small amount of noise from the nearby roads. I had an exterior room, but the road noise didn`t bother me. The attached White Spot restaurant was outstanding, and kid-friendly. The staff at the hotel was very helpful, and they gave a small gift to my young daughter that made her really happy. Do not hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and fair deal”
Reviews.Author: WWanderer
Reviews.Content: Clean room and bathroom. Great wireless Internet. No breakfast included but a White Spot right in the lobby. The neighborhood is iffy and after reading other reviews I was leery about parking our car but the parking under the new wing has a camera so that made me feel a little better. Great location for the airport and also for getting into Vancouver's downtown core via Rt 99. Also a great location for getting OUT of the city - something that can be challenging given the lack of good freeway infrastructure in the downtown area. I suggest one night stays only unless you are on a tight budget. If you are visiting YVR for more than a few days you really should be downtown to get the full experience of Stanley Park, Granville Island, the beaches, etc. It's a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beta_Student
Reviews.Content: this is a pretty good hotel, worth the money you pay for. simple and clean, kinda far from downtown or main attractions, but beside a bus stop which can take you to downtown easily the bus runs regularly, it takes about 45min by bus to downtown or a 20min taxi ride, the hotel's shuttle was quick and easy, but when you get off the plane and wait for the shuttle, you will have to call the hotel for pick up, but there is a free phone to call the hotel but the hotel is worth it, clean room, helpful and knowledgeable service, popular restaurant in the lobby, which has a great breakfast. Excellent price and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Price scam, terrible area, grungy rooms”
Reviews.Author: mb1wny
Reviews.Content: My travel agent got me a good price confirmed by the hotel. I checked in without any issues. Four hours into my stay (around 10pm at night), I was called by front desk and told that I must present an AAA card to get the quoted rate. I argued with 2 different people for about 15 minutes to no avail. Disgusted, I booked a room at a different hotel and prepared to check out in the morning. When I came to check out, the "supervisor" offered to honor the rate that they had quoted but at this point, I no longer trusted these scammers. BTW, while the hotel is close to the airport, it is in a terrible area - the only restaurant within walking distance (if you dare) appeared to be McD's! Also, the room was not particularly clean and if the person in the next room used their shower, you got to hear the noise of rushing water in full glory.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: ILHA
Reviews.Content: The room: There isn’t much to say about the room. It’s clean, the beds are fine. That’s it. Surroundings: It is an airport hotel… so there isn’t very much around it. The hotel is situated right next to a junction (see the picture. Unfortunately, I didn’t photograph the room itself.. :-/ ..). We had a room very close to it. You will hear the cars passing when you are in your room. Maybe a room on the other side is a better idea? I have some doubts about the parking lot. I’m not very sure about the security of the parking lot. The parking lot is accessible to everyone, so everyone can get close to your car. On the other side: you are staying in an large city, so you may expect this kind of parking lots. There is a small bar and a Whitespot restaurant, so eating and drinking isn’t a problem. Location: The hotel is closely located by the airport (app. 5 minutes drive). You can see the hotel from the road… and when you see it (driving from the airport) you wonder: how on earth can I get there… Even with our GPS system it was difficult. But with some strange maneuvers en routes we did get there… Owners/personnel: The persons we spoke were kind and gentle. Conclusion: I guess it is a real “one night stay” room, it’s clean and you can get a good breakfast, dinner and a drink. I’m not sure if I will go back there again. Maybe I will try to find a hotel in a more quiet environment. (we hope that our English is acceptable... if not sorry :-) )

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: JBmomVictoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while we are touring Vancouver. Even though we booked through Priceline, the check-in clerk asked his supervisor if we can get upgraded since we are staying more than overnight. The room was in their renovated wing, quieter, and it has a small fridge, which works out great for having a cold breakfast in the room. They charge $6 for parking but there are lots of parking on the street. I was a bit worried about the safety of the car overnight, but it was fine. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but clean & well-priced”
Reviews.Author: UNLIMITEDSPACE
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is nothing extra-ordinary, it was a nice, clean, modest place to stay. We booked with hotwire for $89/night, so were very happy with the price. I'd suggest asking for a room opposite the traffic side, since it is beside an overpass/bridge exit and on a main traffic flow. We found the staff to be attentive and courteous. Shuttle service to the airport was good, and there is a bus stop steps away from the hotel. You can get anywhere (UBC, downtown, Stanley Park) within 20-40 min.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay at the Coast”
Reviews.Author: JY_Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite convenient and economical for those who need a quite stay during their long layovers. The shuttle bus staff are very courteous and helpful. However during busy times, the hotel front desk counter can get a bit overwhelmed with the traffic. Below is a summary of my stay: Pros: -complimentary shuttle -large counter/desk suitable for doing paperwork or for computer. Cons: - unable to get upgrade with Coast Points -not much around the area for food after hours if you don't have a vehicle. Even though I wasn't able to get the upgrade, the driver of the shuttle was very sympathetic and took down my contact info and the hotel manager called me immediately on the next business day to discuss the issue. They were very understanding and resolved it very professionally.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Balix
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for just one night after a transatlantic flight and found it to be perfectly adequate for our needs. It is close to the airport and reached by menas of the hotel shuttle which took a strange route which bears out the comments of it being difficult to access if you don't know the way. The front desk staff were polite and helpful. The room was small but clean and tidy with a comfortable bed and a good selection of toiletries in the bathroom. There is a White Spot restaurant off the lobby which serves good food at reasonable prices. For a one night stay it did the job at a very reasonable price so why pay more at one of the other airport hotels?

Reviews.Title: “One night only”
Reviews.Author: Ballybrick
Reviews.Content: Definitely a downmarket hotel relying on the one night stopover. Location wise, its close to the airport but that's it. Quality is clean but basic. We booked in about 7.00pm after difficulty with finding a way from the freeway to the carpark entrance and were told that because of the limited number of servers and a party of students who had arrived we couldnt have a meal until later. We were directed to the adjacent, rather seedy, pub to wait. When we did return and get served by a very hassled waitress, the food was good and the service pleasant but the surroundings were 2*. Breakfast next morning was slow due to understaffing and although we had time we did notice other customers leaving before getting served. This hotel is somewhere to put your head down for the night, nothing more!

Reviews.Title: “The Good the Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Tinagirltravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel before AND after a Vacation flying out of Vancouver airport. The Hotel is Located a stones throw from the airport which is a good thing and has a complementary 24 hour shuttle leaving every half hour. The hotel however was VERY difficult to access because it pretty much is on the onramp to the airport. It's clean, but in many ways dated. It looks like it was built in the 70's and parts of every room were updated every decade. The bedding looked and felt like it was about 20 years old. That would have been the one thing I would have changed to make the room feel clean and cozy. Due to the fact that we got this room through a bid on Priceline the front desk staff was not very accomodating to the fact that I had requested 2 beds in the room and when I got there they had us slated for 1 Queen. They said that because we were Priceline we were only guarenteed a bed for 2. In the end I had to pay $10 to get a cot. I have never had that happen before. There is a White Spot Restaraunt in the lobby. They also say they charge $4 for parking per dayWould I stay ther again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: cryetti
Reviews.Content: OK stay. I have never stayed in Vancouver, so I can compare with other places. Hotel staff okay, room okay. We had problems with the toilet (low flush and leaking) but we survived. Yes it is close to the freeway, but we weren't bothered with the noise. We booked the room because we got a good rate on Priceline, however I don't know if I would return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “decent”
Reviews.Author: Man_U_canuck
Reviews.Content: Thanks to air canada some 80+ people were stucked in Vancouver for the night. Requested an airport pick up service and we were stunned seeing only a small van picking up customers (fits 10 people). It’s just a 10 mins ride. Shuffle bus services starts from 5:00, every :00 and :30. If you are at the Vancouver south terminal (Domestic terminal) you have to dial for the service (phone inside building, find the code then dial). The front desk staff was friendly, helpful and speedy. Got to the room (on the 4th floor) it was big...ok, i had a double room all by myself so it's big. Went down for dinner, noticed it's till 10:30 (or was it 10?) so all those 30+ people arriving late won't be able to have dinner, which was unacceptable. Free wireless internet access, go ask the front desk for the password (or dial 0 from your room). There were 2 things I didn't like about the room, first was the noise, you can hear the traffic outside, plus if your next door or the room above you are taking shower, you will hear the water pipe noise; second was the hair on the pillow (eww). Ps. Don’t ask me if it’s value for money cause Air Canada paid for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Homeboynot
Reviews.Content: Nice place. The room was small and it's at a very busy intersection with freeway on-ramp which also makes it a bit hard to get to. I almost had an accident trying to go the wrong way up the one way street next to the hotel (Canadian signage was part of the problem). Free parking and wireless Internet which worked very well. Good maid service. In room air con which can be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “airport convenience”
Reviews.Author: royt5
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vancouver around 8 PM, and wanted a nice but cheap place to stay before we went on into downtown Vancouver. I went to Priceline and asked for a 3 star property and got this hotel for $70 and it turned out to be a very good choice. It was 5 minutes from the airport and after a long flight, we were ready to settle down for the night. It turned out to be very clean and comfortable for the time that we spent there. After I made the reservation for the first night, I decided that I needed to go on Priceline again and get another airport location for the last night there. I again asked for a 3 star property, but decided to bid a little lower, ($60) and got the Coast Vancouver again. It did have free parking, but everywhere you go in Vancouver, there are warning signs about people breaking into your cars. This made me a little nervous, but I made sure that there was nothing visible from the outside and tried to park in a well lighted spot, and didn't have any problems. I almost wish that I had spent my entire vacation at this hotel. It is only about 15 or 20 minutes away from downtown. I stayed 5 nights at another hotel and paid over $100 a night more. Oh well, live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Frugal-Bear
Reviews.Content: Booking directly with the Coast Vancouver Airport Hotel's manager two months in advance, we had a "superior" room from 1-15 August 2006. We asked for a quiet, nonsmoking room, and got it--on the top floor at the far end of the building. The room was large enough for us and our things, and the decent furniture included a round table with two comfortable chairs. The bathroom had plenty of counter space, and the shower flow maintained its temperature steadily. The king-sized bed was reasonably comfortable. The bed and bath linens were adequate, in good condition, and clean. As we'd been told, the room was recently redecorated, and everything promised was provided and in good order. The air-conditioning worked well and was fairly quiet. The coffee-maker worked well, and the small electric cooler (not, strictly speaking, a refrigerator) kept cool enough the few things we put in it for breakfasts and snacks. The draw drapes effectively darkened the room. Local phone calls and 800 calls were included, and the telephone took messages. Parking for our rental car also was included, and there always was space in the garage. A free newspaper was provided Monday-Saturday. Terry robes, an iron, and an ironing board were in the closet, and a hair dryer in the bathroom. The people working at the front desk were polite and helpful not only when we arrived and checked out but whenever we needed information. A laptop computer was available in the lobby for free use by guests (limited to 15 minutes when another was waiting). The housekeeping was careful, thorough, and timely. The hotel is not located adjacent to the airport but across the river in Vancouver, a better location for visiting the city. The hotel also provides free airport shuttle service every half hour on the hour and half hour. We rented a car from an Enterprise location very close to the hotel. All things considered, the Coast Vancouver Airport Hotel provided very good value for what we paid. In my judgment, the management is doing an exceptionally good job. A White Spot restaurant off the lobby provides both meals and room service, which can be charged to one's hotel bill. Service there was sometimes slow, and the food not exceptional value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had absolutly no problems. The room was quite good, nice arrangements, very clean and well maintained. Other have mentioned that there were parking problems but I stayed in the hotel for 3 days and I had no parking problems. Only complaint was there is no free internet in the room. But there is free internet in the lobby. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. The hotel as a attached resturant and pub. Havent been to the pub but the resturant was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “A poor choice”
Reviews.Author: minnsha
Reviews.Content: Noisy and uncomfortable. Was kept awake by the traffic and the thin sheets. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: harttravel
Reviews.Content: Just stayed overnight at this property and thought it was great. Service was friendly and warm, hotel looked in great shape, and the free shuttle had me picked up from the airport and to the hotel within minutes. The price was excellent also. I'd return to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was unremarkable, clean for its class. Good food. Service at front dest unpredicatable. Stayed 1 night before and after our flight out of the country. We left our vehicle in their patrolled parking lot for free, as it was include in our accommodation. Parked in their lot beside the hotel. I have an antitheft device – ignition cut off installed in my truck, was not too concerend. Lot was apparently patrolled daily. Upon return after 1-week holiday I found my truck door open( not just unlocked wide open) with the ignition completly drilled out and a dead battery. The hotel patrol had not noticed anything and offered no apologies and they seemed to be used to this sort of thing.
